text: Barjora is a locality in the Barjora community development block, located in the Bankura Sadar subdivision of the Bankura district in the state of West Bengal, India. It is part of the Bishnupur Lok Sabha constituency and Barjora Vidhan Sabha constituency. The area covers approximately 7.25 square kilometers and has an elevation of 5 meters. As of the 2011 census, Barjora had a population of 14,012 people. The official languages spoken in Barjora are Bengali and English, and it follows Indian Standard Time (IST) with a UTC offset of +5:30. Barjora is a large town with a large area. It stretches from the bridges of Tarasing in the north to the outskirts of Bankura in the south. Its western border is with Baguli. The eastern border is on the rivers of the 7 villages. Category:Settlements in West Bengal
title: Barjora
